017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021
022import java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler;
023import java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory;
024import java.util.function.IntFunction;
025
026import org.apiguardian.api.API;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.ThreadFactoryBuilderImpl;
030
031/**
032 *  <p>{@summary A builder for an implementation of
033 *  {@link ThreadFactory}.}</p>
034 *  <p>All values are optional, but {@code null} is no valid argument value for
035 *  any method in this API.</p>
036 *  <p>The simplest use case to get a valid
037 *  {@link ThreadFactory}
038 *  instance is</p>
039 *  <pre><code>final var threadFactory = ThreadFactoryBuilder.obtainBuilder()
040 *    .build();</code></pre>
041 *
042 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
043 *  @version $Id: ThreadFactoryBuilder.java 1035 2022-12-07 15:09:56Z tquadrat $
044 *  @since 0.1.0
045 *
046 *  @UMLGraph.link
047 */
048@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ThreadFactoryBuilder.java 1035 2022-12-07 15:09:56Z tquadrat $" )
049@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
050public sealed interface ThreadFactoryBuilder
051    permits ThreadFactoryBuilderImpl
052{
053        /*-----------*\
054    ====** Constants **========================================================
055        \*-----------*/
056
057        /*---------*\
058    ====** Methods **==========================================================
059        \*---------*/
060    /**
061     *  Creates the instance of
062     *  {@link java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory}.
063     *
064     *  @return The thread factory.
065     */
066    public ThreadFactory build();
067
068    /**
069     *  Returns an instance of the builder.
070     *
071     *  @return A thread factory builder.
072     */
073    public static ThreadFactoryBuilder obtainBuilder() { return new ThreadFactoryBuilderImpl(); }
074
075    /**
076     *  <p>{@summary Sets the context class loader for the new threads created
077     *  by the new thread factory.}</p>
078     *  <p>The context class loader allows the creator of the thread to provide
079     *  the appropriate class loader, through
080     *  {@link Thread#getContextClassLoader()},
081     *  to code running in the thread when loading classes and resources.</p>
082     *  <p>If not set, new threads will use the system class loader (or,
083     *  failing that, the bootstrap class loader).</p>
084     *
085     *  @param  contextClassLoader  The context classloader.
086     *  @return The builder.
087     *
088     *  @see Thread#setContextClassLoader(ClassLoader)
089     */
090    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setContextClassLoader( final ClassLoader contextClassLoader );
091
092    /**
093     *  <p>{@summary Sets the flag that controls whether the new threads,
094     *  created by the new thread factory, will suppress, or not, the
095     *  inheriting of initial values for
096     *  {@linkplain InheritableThreadLocal inheritable thread-local variables}
097     *  from the constructing thread.} This allows for finer grain control over
098     *  inheritable thread-locals. Care must be taken when setting the flag to
099     *  {@code false}, as it may lead to unexpected behavior if the new thread
100     *  executes code that expects a specific thread-local value to be
101     *  inherited.</p>
102     *  <p>If not set, the value for the new threads will be {@code true}.</p>
103     *
104     *  @param  flag    {@code true} if the values for inheritable thread
105     *      locals will be inherited, {@code false} to disable this feature.
106     *  @return The builder.
107     *
108     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long, boolean)
109     */
110    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setInheritThreadLocals( final boolean flag );
111
112    /**
113     *  <p>{@summary Sets the flag whether the new thread created by the new
114     *  thread factory should be a daemon thread.} Daemon threads will be
115     *  aborted automatically when the last non-daemon thread terminates.</p>
116     *  <p>If not set, the new threads are not daemon threads.</p>
117     *
118     *  @param  flag    {@code true} if the new threads are daemon threads,
119     *      {@code false} if they are regular threads.
120     *  @return The builder.
121     *
122     *  @see Thread#isDaemon()
123     *  @see Thread#setDaemon(boolean)
124     */
125    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setDaemon( final boolean flag );
126
127    /**
128     *  <p>{@summary Sets the factory for the name of the threads created by
129     *  the new thread factory.}</p>
130     *  <p>The name factory method will be call with a numeric argument that is
131     *  unique for each invocation by the new thread factory; in fact, it is a
132     *  counter value.</p>
133     *  <p>If not set, a name factory is used that returns names looking like
134     *  this: &quot;{@code Thread-#}&quot; where the hash symbol will be
135     *  replaced by the counter value.</p>
136     *
137     *  @param  nameFactory The name factory.
138     *  @return The builder.
139     */
140    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setNameFactory( final IntFunction<String> nameFactory );
141
142    /**
143     *  <p>{@summary Sets the priority for the new threads created by the new
144     *  thread factory.} Proper values are -1 (to indicate that the priority
145     *  should not be set explicitly) and numbers between
146     *  {@value Thread#MIN_PRIORITY}
147     *  to
148     *  {@value Thread#MAX_PRIORITY},
149     *  inclusively.</p>
150     *  <p>If not set, the value will be -1.</p>
151     *  <p>If the thread factory will not be configured explicitly with a
152     *  priority, the newly created threads will get their priority set equal
153     *  to the priority of the thread calling
154     *  {@link ThreadFactory#newThread(Runnable)},
155     *  creating a new thread. The method
156     *  {@link Thread#setPriority(int)}
157     *  may be used to change the priority to a new value.</p>
158     *
159     *  @param  priority    The priority value.
160     *  @return The builder.
161     *  @throws ValidationException The given value is not valid.
162     *
163     *  @see Thread#setPriority(int)
164     */
165    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setPriority( final int priority ) throws ValidationException;
166
167    /**
168     *  <p>{@summary Sets the stack size for the new threads created by the new
169     *  thread factory.} The stack size is the approximate number of bytes of
170     *  address space that the virtual machine is to allocate for the new
171     *  thread's stack. The effect of the {@code stackSize} parameter, if any,
172     *  is highly platform dependent.</p>
173     *  <p>On some platforms, specifying a higher value for the
174     *  {@code stackSize} parameter may allow a thread to achieve greater
175     *  recursion depth before throwing a
176     *  {@link StackOverflowError}.
177     *  Similarly, specifying a lower value may allow a greater number of
178     *  threads to exist concurrently without throwing an
179     *  {@link OutOfMemoryError}
180     *  (or other internal error). The details of the relationship between the
181     *  value of the {@code stackSize} parameter and the maximum recursion
182     *  depth and concurrency level are platform-dependent. On some platforms,
183     *  the value of the {@code stackSize} parameter may have no effect
184     *  whatsoever.</p>
185     *  <p>The virtual machine is free to treat the stackSize parameter as a
186     *  suggestion. If the specified value is unreasonably low for the
187     *  platform, the virtual machine may instead use some platform-specific
188     *  minimum value; if the specified value is unreasonably high, the virtual
189     *  machine may instead use some platform-specific maximum. Likewise, the
190     *  virtual machine is free to round the specified value up or down as it
191     *  sees fit (or to ignore it completely).</p>
192     *  <p>Specifying a value of zero for the {@code stackSize} parameter will
193     *  cause the new tread factory to not set the stack size for the new
194     *  threads explicitly.</p>
195     *
196     *  @note Due to the platform-dependent nature of the behaviour regarding
197     *      this configuration value, extreme care should be exercised in its
198     *      use. The thread stack size necessary to perform a given computation
199     *      will likely vary from one JRE implementation to another. In light
200     *      of this variation, careful tuning of the stack size parameter may
201     *      be required, and the tuning may need to be repeated for each JRE
202     *      implementation on which an application is to run.
203     *
204     *  @param  stackSize   The stack size for the new threads.
205     *  @return The builder.
206     *
207     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long, boolean)
208     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long)
209     */
210    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setStackSize( final long stackSize );
211
212    /**
213     *  <p>{@summary Sets the thread group for the new threads created by the
214     *  new thread factory.}</p>
215     *  <p>If no thread group will be specified, the thread group for threads
216     *  created by the new thread factory is set to the thread group of the
217     *  thread that called .
218     *  {@link ThreadFactory#newThread(Runnable)}.</p>
219     *
220     *  @param  threadGroup The thread group.
221     *  @return The builder.
222     *
223     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long, boolean)
224     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String, long)
225     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, String)
226     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable)
227     *  @see Thread#Thread(ThreadGroup, Runnable, String)
228     */
229    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setThreadGroup( final ThreadGroup threadGroup );
230
231    /**
232     *  <p>{@summary Sets the
233     *  {@link java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler UncaughtExceptionHandler}
234     *  for the new threads created by the new thread factory.}</p>
235     *  <p>No handler will be set if none is specified for the new factory.</p>
236     *
237     *  @param  uncaughtExceptionHandler    The uncaught exception handler.
238     *  @return The builder.
239     *
240     *  @see Thread#setUncaughtExceptionHandler(UncaughtExceptionHandler)
241     *  @see Thread#setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler(UncaughtExceptionHandler)
242     *  @see Thread#getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
243     *  @see Thread#getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()
244     *  @see ThreadGroup#uncaughtException(Thread, Throwable)
245     */
246    public ThreadFactoryBuilder setUncaughtExceptionHandler( final UncaughtExceptionHandler uncaughtExceptionHandler );
247}
248//  interface ThreadFactoryBuilder
249
250/*
251 *  End of File
252 */
